intro: Keraselma ciliatum, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Keraselma ciliatum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental foliage.
